short_description: This function is used to perform click stream analysis.
long_description: This function is used to perform click stream analysis.It has many kinds of computation models and distribution models.

input_tables.name: input
input_tables.rDescription: Contains the click stream data, which the function uses to compute attributions.
input_tables.description: Contains the click stream data, which the function uses to compute attributions.

input_tables.name: input2
input_tables.rDescription: Contains the click stream data, which the function uses to compute attributions.
input_tables.description: Contains the click stream data, which the function uses to compute attributions.

input_tables.name: conversion
input_tables.rDescription: Contains one varchar column (conversion_events) containing conversion event values.
input_tables.description: Contains one varchar column (conversion_events) containing conversion event values.

input_tables.name: excluding
input_tables.rDescription: Contains one varchar column (excluding_events) containing excluding cause event values.
input_tables.description: Contains one varchar column (excluding_events) containing excluding cause event values.

input_tables.name: optional
input_tables.rDescription: Contains one varchar column (optional_events) containing optional cause event values.
input_tables.description: Contains one varchar column (optional_events) containing optional cause event values.

input_tables.name: model1
input_tables.rDescription: Defines the type and specification of the first model. For example: model1.data ('EVENT_REGULAR', 'email:0.19:LAST_CLICK:NA', 'impression:0.81:WEIGHTED:0.4,0.3,0.2,0.1')
input_tables.description: Defines the type and specification of the first model. For example: Model1 ('EVENT_REGULAR', 'email:0.19:LAST_CLICK:NA', 'impression:0.81:WEIGHTED:0.4,0.3,0.2,0.1')

input_tables.name: model2
input_tables.rDescription: Defines the type and distributions of the second model. For example: model2.data ('EVENT_OPTIONAL', 'OrganicSearch:0.5:UNIFORM:NA', 'Direct:0.3:UNIFORM:NA', 'Referral:0.2:UNIFORM:NA')
input_tables.description: Defines the type and distributions of the second model. For example: Model2 ('EVENT_OPTIONAL', 'OrganicSearch:0.5:UNIFORM:NA', 'Direct:0.3:UNIFORM:NA', 'Referral:0.2:UNIFORM:NA')

argument_clauses.name: EventColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the input column that contains the clickstream events.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name of the input column that contains the clickstream events.

argument_clauses.name: TimestampColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the input column that contains the timestamps of the clickstream events.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name of the input column that contains the timestamps of the clickstream events.

argument_clauses.name: WindowSize
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies how to determine the maximum window size for the attribution calculation: rows:K: Consider the maximum number of events to be attributed, excluding events of types specified in excluding_event_table, which means assigning attributions to at most K effective events before the current impact event.seconds:K: Consider the maximum time difference between the current impact event and the earliest effective event to be attributed. rows:K&seconds:K2: Consider both constraints and comply with the stricter one.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies how to determine the maximum window size for the attribution calculation: rows:K: Consider the maximum number of events to be attributed, excluding events of types specified in excluding_event_table, which means assigning attributions to at most K effective events before the current impact event.seconds:K: Consider the maximum time difference between the current impact event and the earliest effective event to be attributed. rows:K&seconds:K2: Consider both constraints and comply with the stricter one.

argument_clauses.name: ConversionEvents
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the conversion events. Each conversion_event is a string or integer
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the conversion events. Each conversion_event is a string or integer

argument_clauses.name: ExcludeEvents
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the events to exclude from the attribution calculation. Each exclude_event is a string or integer. An exclude_event cannot be a conversion_event.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the events to exclude from the attribution calculation. Each exclude_event is a string or integer. An exclude_event cannot be a conversion_event.

argument_clauses.name: OptionalEvents
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the optional events. Each optional_event is a string or integer. An optional_event cannot be a conversion_event or exclude_event. The function attributes a conversion event to	 an optional event only if it cannot attribute it to a regular event.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the optional events. Each optional_event is a string or integer. An optional_event cannot be a conversion_event or exclude_event. The function attributes a conversion event to	 an optional event only if it cannot attribute it to a regular event.

argument_clauses.name: SequenceInputBy
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the LIST_VECTOR of column(s) that uniquely identifies each row of the input argument INPUT_ARG_NAME. The argument is used to ensure deterministic results for functions which produce results that vary from run to run.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the input column(s) that uniquely identify each row of input table. The format is 'input1:c1' where input1 refers to the alias used by the input table that contains such column named c1.
